alert.note: Alert for Coastal Martin; Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 04 at 2:46AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following areas, Coastal Indian River, Coastal Martin, Coastal Saint Lucie, Inland Indian River, Inland Martin, Inland Saint Lucie and Okeechobee. * WHEN...Through sunset. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall ahead of Potential Tropical Cyclone One will continue to spread north across the Lake Okeechobee and Treasure Coast regions. An additional 1 to 3 inches of rain is possible, with locally higher amounts along the coast. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Martin; Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee
